revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2016-08-18 14:24:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/storagepolicy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Add ensure_backing_from_*

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. ensure_backing_from_func() and
ensure_backing_from_image() perform the same function except they:

* do it explicitly.
* will not create a disk if it doesn't exist.

The latter is a feature for finish_migration which explicitly only
requires backing files to be created.

Note that the only image backend which requires these checks is Qcow2,
as no other backend uses a backing file.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I76ab8aa662b2e2438941e35de2e191db42f59242
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add ensure_backing_from_*

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. ensure_backing_from_func() and
ensure_backing_from_image() perform the same function except they:

* do it explicitly.
* will not create a disk if it doesn't exist.

The latter is a feature for finish_migration which explicitly only
requires backing files to be created.

Note that the only image backend which requires these checks is Qcow2,
as no other backend uses a backing file.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I76ab8aa662b2e2438941e35de2e191db42f59242

subject: Don't query raw_template in stacks uselessly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 19:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/objects/stack.py'], 'message': "Don't query raw_template in stacks uselessly

When partially removing eager loading of raw_template in stacks
(260b79ed28b5dc48f70fe77dfdfc074991ad1e99), we didn't get into account
that accessing the sqlalchemy field would create an additional query
whereas it was previously eager loaded. This removes it by only filling
the field when it's already fetched.

Change-Id: Ifa17c74e3559adaef56593a205101d92e9a37da5
Closes-Bug: #1634127
"}]
commit_message:
Don't query raw_template in stacks uselessly

When partially removing eager loading of raw_template in stacks
(260b79ed28b5dc48f70fe77dfdfc074991ad1e99), we didn't get into account
that accessing the sqlalchemy field would create an additional query
whereas it was previously eager loaded. This removes it by only filling
the field when it's already fetched.

Change-Id: Ifa17c74e3559adaef56593a205101d92e9a37da5
Closes-Bug: #1634127

subject: Allow for specifying a KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE
revisions:

Incases where it is useful to place many config.json files

Change-Id: I107655b3c5b1a4fa45e692850b360b316180d795

commit_message:
Allow for specifying a KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE

Incases where it is useful to place many config.json files
under the same directory (ie one for config_glance_api.json or
one for config_glance_registry.json) we should be able to
specify which file under that directory do we actually want to
use (instead of assuming it is always config.json).

(cherry picked from commit e284d4fbeac8b54c6b69d047167a375605f3eb83)

Change-Id: I107655b3c5b1a4fa45e692850b360b316180d795

subject: Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 08:28:48.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/common/test_dbmodels.py', 'integration/tests/integration/tests/volumes/driver.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I4bc4634829560089d933d425b2195139fdadd5cb
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I4bc4634829560089d933d425b2195139fdadd5cb

re-sync only plugins that don't have notifications.

Implement blueprint: reindex-interval

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 01:18:42.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/fake_client.py', 'solumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I837e65c37d434b0f8b01a16858394475615bd2ff
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I837e65c37d434b0f8b01a16858394475615bd2ff

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-04 12:52:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/service_drivers/cisco_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/db/vpn/test_vpn_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/service_drivers/ipsec_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_models.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/extensions/vpnaas.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/service_drivers/test_cisco_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/ocata/expand/38893903cbde_add_auth_algorithm_sha384_and_sha512.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py'], 'message': 'Add sha384 and sha512 auth algorithms for vendor drivers

Currently, VPNaaS limits the IPSec and IKE auth algorithm to
"sha1" and "sha256". If user add a new driver(eg, Hardware VPN Gateway),
and the new driver supports more auth algorithms, such as "sha2-384",
"sha2-512", it can not integrated with current VPNaaS plugin.

This patch add "sha384" and "sha512" auth algorithms in API and DB side,
Because of Openswan, Strongswan, Libreswan and Cisco CSR driver doesn't
support these, so we add a validator in ipsec and Cisco CSR service driver,
that will raise an exception when creating or updating the IPSec/IKE Policy
auth algorithm with "sha384" and "sha512".
Other vendors can bypass validate ike_policy and ipsec_policy
when creating and updating auth_algorithm, or implement specific
logic for themselves.

DocImpact
APIImpact
NOTE: CLI support also needs change.

Closes-Bug: #1638152
Change-Id: I87b257ee6500c424fc273955a6d89d972a2823e9
'}]
commit_message:
Add sha384 and sha512 auth algorithms for vendor drivers

Currently, VPNaaS limits the IPSec and IKE auth algorithm to
"sha1" and "sha256". If user add a new driver(eg, Hardware VPN Gateway),
and the new driver supports more auth algorithms, such as "sha2-384",
"sha2-512", it can not integrated with current VPNaaS plugin.

This patch add "sha384" and "sha512" auth algorithms in API and DB side,
Because of Openswan, Strongswan, Libreswan and Cisco CSR driver doesn't
support these, so we add a validator in ipsec and Cisco CSR service driver,
that will raise an exception when creating or updating the IPSec/IKE Policy
auth algorithm with "sha384" and "sha512".
Other vendors can bypass validate ike_policy and ipsec_policy
when creating and updating auth_algorithm, or implement specific
logic for themselves.

DocImpact
APIImpact
NOTE: CLI support also needs change.

Closes-Bug: #1638152
Change-Id: I87b257ee6500c424fc273955a6d89d972a2823e9

commit_message:
devstack: Quit reading fwaas_driver.ini when fwaas is enabled

fwaas_driver.ini is no longer created when fwaas is enabled. [1]
The file shouldn't be read to avoid failing to launch neutron-vpnaas.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350362/

Change-Id: I2147cfd405ced1dde2b3abb6b430ff032466274c
Closes-Bug: #1617154

commit_message:
IPsec traffic metering for VPNaaS

This blueprint covers the support of IPsec traffic metering for VPNaaS by
adding metering function to the VPN agent. This VPNaaS metering feature would
support VPN service for various architectures such as VPN with l3-agent or VPN
with OVN solution.

Related-bug: #1591993
Co-Authored-By: Grace <huangyur@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bepsy <paulbe@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: MingShuangXian <xianms@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Iede9139c4f393bd24773d0001a81a63415bb850f

commit_message:
Modification to improve error/help message for extensions

Neutron CLIs return "404 Not Found" error message when they
cannot work on a extension( like VPNaaS, FWaaS etc) or when they
are not able to determine the information.
However "404 Not found" error message is not correct and not
descriptive enough for the end user to work upon. This fix tries
to improve on the same message.
Also, if extensions are not enabled, then help for the same should
not be displayed. This patch also attempts to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I89a271880c291fa13bff95a8f8fc4e1d6b7ae415
Closes-Bug: #1496748
Closes-Bug: #1094713

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Closes-Bug: #1552251
Change-Id: I9465e116e52517fecc651ef01d8e3fc7b78b7e48

commit_message:
Add insecure option in functional tests for SSL endpoints

This patch fixes the issue when functional tests are run
against a deployment that has https based endpoints.
The insecure option is not being passed when initiating
magnumclient or keystoneclient as a result we get SSL
error.

Change-Id: I35525917b96b64e57c984924c72b3c696949f67f
Closes-Bug: #1640341

commit_message:
Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface not set for DHCP

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640598,
there are situations in which the dhclient instance started by
dhcp-all-interfaces runs even after the interface is no longer
configured for DHCP.  This change will terminate the instance
using the '-r' argument if 'BOOTPROTO' is not set to 'dhcp' in
the ifcfg file for the interface.  The dhclient will only be
stopped if a dhclient pid file exists, the pid file will be
removed after stopping dhclient.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8a52ef5fb8052f185c01dcc27a1ecd70f5d630c8
Closes-Bug: 1640598

subject: Avoid UnboundLocalErrors in _create_bulk_ml2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 22:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Avoid UnboundLocalErrors in _create_bulk_ml2

The exception handler blocks in _create_bulk_ml2 assumed
some local variables from iterations would be present.
This led to masking errors caused by failures in starting
the session or fetching the method with getattr because
the local variable reference would result in an
UnboundLocalError exception.

This patch just narrows the exception handlers to the
iterations.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I74908817049826d1329a3e50cccc4c2c5708b621
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid UnboundLocalErrors in _create_bulk_ml2

The exception handler blocks in _create_bulk_ml2 assumed
some local variables from iterations would be present.
This led to masking errors caused by failures in starting
the session or fetching the method with getattr because
the local variable reference would result in an
UnboundLocalError exception.

This patch just narrows the exception handlers to the
iterations.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I74908817049826d1329a3e50cccc4c2c5708b621

subject: Remove duplicated 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's requests
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-01 11:50:12.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'message': "Remove duplicated 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's requests

When Object-Server saves async-update in pickle files,
'User-Agent: object-server %(pid)' (the key is title style) is included
in the pickles. However, Object-Updater will add
'user-agent: object-updater %(pid)' (the key is lower case style) to the
pickled headers and use it to make http connection. According to RFC
7230, each header field consists of a case-insensitive field name,
therefore either of 'User-Agent' and 'user-agent' should not be included
in the headers.

This patch removes old 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's
requests.

Change-Id: Ia624558395584457c718b311fe80e1a8406e22ad
Closes-Bug:#1635114
"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicated 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's requests

When Object-Server saves async-update in pickle files,
'User-Agent: object-server %(pid)' (the key is title style) is included
in the pickles. However, Object-Updater will add
'user-agent: object-updater %(pid)' (the key is lower case style) to the
pickled headers and use it to make http connection. According to RFC
7230, each header field consists of a case-insensitive field name,
therefore either of 'User-Agent' and 'user-agent' should not be included
in the headers.

This patch removes old 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's
requests.

Change-Id: Ia624558395584457c718b311fe80e1a8406e22ad
Closes-Bug:#1635114

commit_message:
Enable EPEL repository for CentOS amphorae

This is needed to install the package 'jq'

Not needed for other Red Hat variants:
* Fedora has jq in its main repo
*  RHEL has it in OpenStack repos (required to build a RHEL amphora)

Change-Id: I5c1c911c28215410b7f4c984bee8a69f0bee43eb
Closes-Bug: #1640827

subject: diskimage-create check for qemu-kvm-ev/qemu-img-ev for CentOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 11:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'message': 'diskimage-create check for qemu-kvm-ev/qemu-img-ev for CentOS

Checking packages using "yum list installed qemu-kvm/qemu-img" fails for
Centos,while qemu-kvm-ev and qemu-img-ev are installed using
"RDO CentOS-7 - QEMU EV".

This repository is added by devstack.

I changed the shell script to check [qemu-kvm qemu-img] and [kpartx git]
separately and when [qemu-kvm qemu-img] are not found, check for
qemu-kvm-ev or qemu-img-ev instead of exiting.

Change-Id: I5bd929e5aba76319cc86e0fc97825929e32629c2
Close-Bug: #1637435
'}]
commit_message:
diskimage-create check for qemu-kvm-ev/qemu-img-ev for CentOS

Checking packages using "yum list installed qemu-kvm/qemu-img" fails for
Centos,while qemu-kvm-ev and qemu-img-ev are installed using
"RDO CentOS-7 - QEMU EV".

This repository is added by devstack.

I changed the shell script to check [qemu-kvm qemu-img] and [kpartx git]
separately and when [qemu-kvm qemu-img] are not found, check for
qemu-kvm-ev or qemu-img-ev instead of exiting.

Change-Id: I5bd929e5aba76319cc86e0fc97825929e32629c2
Close-Bug: #1637435

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 02:00:46.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/cmd/house_keeping.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I77c9b9783c623167ada1631cf05bf4cf4c40e6b1
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I77c9b9783c623167ada1631cf05bf4cf4c40e6b1

subject: Wrong result is returned when call events getting API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6676, 'name': 'zqfan', 'email': 'aji.zqfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'aji-zqfan'}, {'_account_id': 8358, 'name': 'zhangguoqing', 'email': 'zhang.guoqing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhangguoqing'}, {'_account_id': 9526, 'name': 'Zi Lian Ji', 'email': 'jizilian@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jizilian'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 15192, 'name': 'Marek Aufart', 'email': 'maufart@redhat.com', 'username': 'maufart'}, {'_account_id': 18137, 'name': 'Xia Linjuan', 'email': 'ljxiash@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'xialinjuan'}, {'_account_id': 20863, 'name': 'Sharat Sharma', 'email': 'sharat.sharma@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'sharat.sharma'}, {'_account_id': 22165, 'name': 'caoyuan', 'email': 'cao.yingjunz@gmail.com', 'username': 'caoyuan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 06:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/api/v2/test_query.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/events.py'], 'message': "Wrong result is returned when call events getting API

For current implementation, events getting API only support 'eq' query
operation when query field is the one of 'event_type', 'message_id',
'start_timestamp' and 'end_timestamp'. But there is a problem, if the
query operation wasn't specified as 'eq'(e.g. 'ne'), the returned result
is still the same as the query operation was specified as 'eq'.

This patch add a check for this situation: if the query field is the one
of 'event_type', 'message_id', 'start_timestamp', 'end_timestamp', and
the query operation user specified is not 'eq', then a client side error
will be thrown.

Also, corresponding unit test case is added.

Change-Id: I4e4b127045de6e933281d9289271af891c3c80fe
Closes-Bug: #1558594
(cherry picked from commit ac3ff88c03ea3685d7f3511bbae16785646e56ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Wrong result is returned when call events getting API

For current implementation, events getting API only support 'eq' query
operation when query field is the one of 'event_type', 'message_id',
'start_timestamp' and 'end_timestamp'. But there is a problem, if the
query operation wasn't specified as 'eq'(e.g. 'ne'), the returned result
is still the same as the query operation was specified as 'eq'.

This patch add a check for this situation: if the query field is the one
of 'event_type', 'message_id', 'start_timestamp', 'end_timestamp', and
the query operation user specified is not 'eq', then a client side error
will be thrown.

Also, corresponding unit test case is added.

Change-Id: I4e4b127045de6e933281d9289271af891c3c80fe
Closes-Bug: #1558594
(cherry picked from commit ac3ff88c03ea3685d7f3511bbae16785646e56ba)

commit_message:
Use oooq to install the undercloud

This patch shows what it might look like to have tripleo.sh consume
tripleo-quickstart for some functionality. It adds a new --oooq option
that will use tripleo-quickstart for the undercloud install.

Change-Id: I4941e922a388eae205a73769355f7860f2ba9efe

subject: Use undercloud-virt-setup tag for Ironic pxe_ssh configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-01 12:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo/undercloud/tasks/main.yml', 'quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'Use undercloud-virt-setup tag for Ironic pxe_ssh configuration

This task is not always needed unless the tripleo-quickstart virt setup
was also used. Tag it with a new tag, undercloud-virt-setup so that it
can be disabled if desired. Add the new tag to the default tags used in
quickstart.sh.

The delegate_to functionality is also not needed, so that is cleaned up
as well.

Change-Id: I4aaa0eb1e666c2756134536519f326283625d81b
'}]
commit_message:
Use undercloud-virt-setup tag for Ironic pxe_ssh configuration

This task is not always needed unless the tripleo-quickstart virt setup
was also used. Tag it with a new tag, undercloud-virt-setup so that it
can be disabled if desired. Add the new tag to the default tags used in
quickstart.sh.

The delegate_to functionality is also not needed, so that is cleaned up
as well.

Change-Id: I4aaa0eb1e666c2756134536519f326283625d81b

commit_message:
DNM: DVR: debug multinode job failure

Sometimes seeing "RTNETLINK answers: Network is unreachable"
trying to add default route in DHCP namespace.  This is
happening because we have not added any IP to the tap
interface.  Trying to debug why we didn't...

Change-Id: Ia6020e2eb7f00987fdf8aa2ed062073d9251cbeb

commit_message:
Make service_checks easier to run independently of kolla-ansible

Set a default for CONFIG_DIR in service_checks to more easily allow
consumers not using the kolla-ansible tool to run the prechecks.

subject: Move manila-share service to network node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 13:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/inventory/multinode', 'ansible/inventory/all-in-one'], 'message': 'Move manila-share service to network node

After a research regarding manila-share node,
is required that for the generic driver the
manila-share service should be run on the network node.

As the generic driver is our default driver, so this change is needed.

Closes-Bug: #1639028
Change-Id: I4b73fec4f96e3e2f9c442c8716941bede5dfbc8e
(cherry picked from commit a2707ecf0043d5df25d0f87d6dde55aeb52260da)
'}]
commit_message:
Move manila-share service to network node

After a research regarding manila-share node,
is required that for the generic driver the
manila-share service should be run on the network node.

As the generic driver is our default driver, so this change is needed.

Closes-Bug: #1639028
Change-Id: I4b73fec4f96e3e2f9c442c8716941bede5dfbc8e

subject: Revert "Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 19:12:22.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'"

This reverts commit d6a054376d2956a15b79a40e530bcbf67a7dda65.

This commit caused bug 1642362, by changing when extra-vars were
read, which in some cases caused the ironic-inspector devstack plugin
to be enabled in local.conf before the ironic plugin, causing failures.

Change-Id: I9a19d7ddaa982b692b4fd678e823f742bfa4bd03
Closes-bug: #1642362
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'"

This reverts commit d6a054376d2956a15b79a40e530bcbf67a7dda65.

This commit caused bug 1642362, by changing when extra-vars were
read, which in some cases caused the ironic-inspector devstack plugin
to be enabled in local.conf before the ironic plugin, causing failures.

Change-Id: I9a19d7ddaa982b692b4fd678e823f742bfa4bd03
Closes-bug: #1642362

subject: Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 20:00:30.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of networking-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of networking-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Ibd7052a62f7dfb85e6e18a5e1c4073bf43b88af4
'}]
commit_message:
Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of networking-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of networking-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Ibd7052a62f7dfb85e6e18a5e1c4073bf43b88af4

commit_message:
Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of ceilometer-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of ceilometer-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Ib60ee84ecb168991439ac5d097ba07a62d2329a7

commit_message:
Add the slaac ipv6 address mode without ra mode

SLAAC can be used without the ipv6_ra_mode being set and an external router will
be used for routing.

Change-Id: Ic49ab978cff92d52dddbbe37d4c7ef0f7ca51bd3

commit_message:
Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of nova-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of nova-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Id8e117bc6a7b1b224a9e86e9b29821627adb51db

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ie68850e529eee51c66e8d29a9025e1390576bc1a
Closes-bug: #1082248

subject: neutron: restore votes for rally job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 18:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'neutron: restore votes for rally job

Ia842991bdeb17592a2a2cf91f2a7cbd7893a7ddf mistakenly removed a line that
effectively made the rally job back to non-voting (plus making some
other unrelated job voting). This patch restores sanity.

Change-Id: I50c7cf6a28f617b9eeb0319305a07fe601bd14c6
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: restore votes for rally job

Ia842991bdeb17592a2a2cf91f2a7cbd7893a7ddf mistakenly removed a line that
effectively made the rally job back to non-voting (plus making some
other unrelated job voting). This patch restores sanity.

Change-Id: I50c7cf6a28f617b9eeb0319305a07fe601bd14c6

commit_message:
Remove setting of OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION for newton and above

We do this already in instack-undercloud, and it should be supported
by image create already.

Change-Id: I3bfae155d4e7594d8212e91fa92c7b8860cb925c

subject: Restrict branches that nova-net grenade jobs run on
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 17:58:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Restrict branches that nova-net grenade jobs run on

Change I33e8c81bb5366d2d1feccc144baa54ed3ed51e33 made the
gate-grenade-dsvm-{node}, gate-grenade-dsvm-forward and
gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode jobs run specifically with
nova-network.

Change I62348f39b58e188b85d18918cfd302fa2d006907 attempted
to restrict those nova-net grenade jobs to only run on
branches <= Newton because in master (ocata) nova is going
to make nova-network not run unless cells v1 is configured:

I7309afa5230bcaeeeddb554d95c327d3a614ae6e

However, that restriction was failing because of a later
definition to not run any gate-grenade-dsvm* jobs on
stable/liberty, which effectively meant that those nova-net
grenade jobs would run on master since master != stable/liberty.

This change makes the nova-net grenade job branch restrictions
more obvious, and also moves the global 'don't run grenade on the
oldest branch' rule before the more specific filters as the last
match wins, so we want to do generic filters first and specific
filters after that.

Change-Id: I47f72eac6a7657bf44319fa5d2df18ce62827f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict branches that nova-net grenade jobs run on

Change I33e8c81bb5366d2d1feccc144baa54ed3ed51e33 made the
gate-grenade-dsvm-{node}, gate-grenade-dsvm-forward and
gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode jobs run specifically with
nova-network.

Change I62348f39b58e188b85d18918cfd302fa2d006907 attempted
to restrict those nova-net grenade jobs to only run on
branches <= Newton because in master (ocata) nova is going
to make nova-network not run unless cells v1 is configured:

I7309afa5230bcaeeeddb554d95c327d3a614ae6e

However, that restriction was failing because of a later
definition to not run any gate-grenade-dsvm* jobs on
stable/liberty, which effectively meant that those nova-net
grenade jobs would run on master since master != stable/liberty.

This change makes the nova-net grenade job branch restrictions
more obvious, and also moves the global 'don't run grenade on the
oldest branch' rule before the more specific filters as the last
match wins, so we want to do generic filters first and specific
filters after that.

Change-Id: I47f72eac6a7657bf44319fa5d2df18ce62827f6f

commit_message:
change networking-sfc python test job from python-db-job to python-job

  - The change is to make networking-sfc unittests name the same as other
    projects. Currently our unittest job name is like
    networking-sfc-python27-db-jobs, others like neutron-python27-jobs.
    It may make code reviewers confuse that we only cover db unittests.

Change-Id: I0b8c92486553aae6e8165fbbf3c8ec342b19b16a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 15:03:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Force gate-{name}-pep8-{node} to build needed wheels

In an effort to make our bindep dependencies better, we want to
have the pep8 jobs not use our wheel mirrors.  This ensures that
projects are able to be build properly if our wheel mirror is down or
a new python dependency is released by has not been build by our
wheel-build job.

This has a high chance of breaking existing jobs that are depending on
openstack-infra wheel mirrors.

Change-Id: I0880b96cdca024965d92e120389eb25939436daa
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Force gate-{name}-pep8-{node} to build needed wheels

In an effort to make our bindep dependencies better, we want to
have the pep8 jobs not use our wheel mirrors.  This ensures that
projects are able to be build properly if our wheel mirror is down or
a new python dependency is released by has not been build by our
wheel-build job.

This has a high chance of breaking existing jobs that are depending on
openstack-infra wheel mirrors.

Change-Id: I0880b96cdca024965d92e120389eb25939436daa
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add microversion cap information

Currently we only publish the master branch of api-ref to:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute
and we have microversion caps for different releases.
It will be better for user to understand if we add
also microversion caps information to the doc.

Change-Id: Ic6c042f68f5d340a68abad6701e65d44e46da3a7
Closes-bug: #1640995

commit_message:
Docs: Document using operators with root device hints

This patch is adding documentation for operators in root device hints:
In which release they are available, what are the supported operators
and few usage examples.

The patch also adds a link to the documentation in the release note.

Closes-Bug: #1561137

subject: Hyper-V PCI Passthrough spec
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-18 06:56:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/hyper-v-pci-passthrough.rst'], 'message': "Hyper-V PCI Passthrough spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-pci-passthrough

Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016, offering
users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express devices in their
systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM.

Currently, the Hyper-V Driver doesn't support PCI device passthrough to VMs.
This blueprint is addressing this issue.

Change-Id: I05b59bca613b024f0a6d41c97658bd63767b9637
"}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V PCI Passthrough spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-pci-passthrough

Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016, offering
users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express devices in their
systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM.

Currently, the Hyper-V Driver doesn't support PCI device passthrough to VMs.
This blueprint is addressing this issue.

Change-Id: I05b59bca613b024f0a6d41c97658bd63767b9637

subject: Do proper deprecation for security group rule create
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 13:53:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/network/v2/security_group_rule.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1637365-b90cdcc05ffc7d3a.yaml'], 'message': 'Do proper deprecation for security group rule create

Review I03fd0e14e470e7272930ac2651e73263b83bd4e1 renamed the
--src-group and --src-ip options to --remote-group and --remote-ip
but did not properly deprecate the old option names.

Add deprecation warnings when the old option names are used.

Also, format the warnings using the new proposed translation guideline
for marking substrings to not be translated, such as literal names
and option names.

Change-Id: I63d085d190fc28b8637e7686016eda4efbdda1be
'}]
commit_message:
Do proper deprecation for security group rule create

Review I03fd0e14e470e7272930ac2651e73263b83bd4e1 renamed the
--src-group and --src-ip options to --remote-group and --remote-ip
but did not properly deprecate the old option names.

Add deprecation warnings when the old option names are used.

Also, format the warnings using the new proposed translation guideline
for marking substrings to not be translated, such as literal names
and option names.

commit_message:
LinuxBridge: Pass host into get_devices_details_list

Pass the host into get_devices_details_list on the linux bridge
agent so the debug logs on the server side don't show "host None".
This is mainly just for cosmetics and consistency with the OVS agent
since the only thing the host is really used for on the server side
is special treatment of DVR ports, which does not currently apply
to linux bridge.

Change-Id: I700fa26982bdb087cf7ea4b3eb69aec2f2e099c8
Closes-Bug: #1622566
(cherry picked from commit 2fe2efc55db4cffe90dd284cb074de81e0efbd4e)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-15 11:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hascheduler_db.py'], 'message': "Avoid trace in _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update

Backport [1] is causing trace in _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update.
This callback is invoked for each port's AFTER_UPDATE event, but
initial port updates(for example, port binding) won't have
allowed_address_pairs as part of port DB.
With this change, _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update will only process
port if the event is from update_device_up i.e after port is
completely configured.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364407/
Closes-Bug: #1640701

Change-Id: If8aa47d154f229e5597e43efd402bcadb7db03ac
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid trace in _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update

Backport [1] is causing trace in _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update.
This callback is invoked for each port's AFTER_UPDATE event, but
initial port updates(for example, port binding) won't have
allowed_address_pairs as part of port DB.
With this change, _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update will only process
port if the event is from update_device_up i.e after port is
completely configured.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364407/
Closes-Bug: #1640701

Change-Id: If8aa47d154f229e5597e43efd402bcadb7db03ac

commit_message:
Increase haproxy timeouts

It's been proposed this may help with the
('Connection aborted.', BadStatusLine("''",)) errors.

This patch increase queue, server and client timeouts to 2m (default is 1m)
Related-Bug: #1638908

Change-Id: Ie4f059f3fad2271bb472697e85ede296eee91f5d
(cherry picked from commit 1bee7bc8fa0ca5ace330e54bc3e64d7f6692d5a7)

subject: Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-15 21:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/glance/lite-specs.rst'], 'message': 'Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.

urrently image location updates (removing, replacing) are permitted for
images even if their state is not ``active``.
This lite-spec describes the need to prevent removal of image
locations of images that are not in ``active`` state and the replacement of
image locations of images that are not in ``active`` or ``queued`` state by
returning a Conflict Error (409 response code).

Change-Id: I8e8bdbd95baca8586afc68e56c984b6adc4ca591
'}]
commit_message:
Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.

urrently image location updates (removing, replacing) are permitted for
images even if their state is not ``active``.
This lite-spec describes the need to prevent removal of image
locations of images that are not in ``active`` state and the replacement of
image locations of images that are not in ``active`` or ``queued`` state by
returning a Conflict Error (409 response code).

Change-Id: I8e8bdbd95baca8586afc68e56c984b6adc4ca591

This commit adds the ability to configure the testing host to run in secury
mode. If specified in by the NFS_SECURE_FILE_OPERATIONS option, the NFS server

Change-Id: Ibaa91774b7ac19b39aa4ed7b4792c4f77a4d20f2

commit_message:
Adds NFS secure/unsecure options

This commit adds the ability to configure the testing host to run in secury
mode. If specified in by the NFS_SECURE_FILE_OPERATIONS option, the NFS server
and Cinder NFS driver will be configured to run in secure mode.

Change-Id: Ibaa91774b7ac19b39aa4ed7b4792c4f77a4d20f2

commit_message:
Do not manage overcloud repositories when using external Ceph

ceph::profile::params::manage_repo should default to false when
using external Ceph.

Overcloud Ceph clients use Ceph packages, which may be provided by
the 'ceph' metapackage, but not for all repos, see related bug. So,
this change also includes a list of packages as a workaround as
used in change Ie55d22301dd22102d471e6002dfcaad4bfadd5f6.

Change-Id: I338e51637aa39d3f7bbbad0263740f728d42cb9b
Closes-bug: 1641989
Related-Bug: 1629933

subject: Fixes TypeError/other bugs in Environment OverviewTab find_stack.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 15:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/environments/tabs.py'], 'message': "Fixes TypeError/other bugs in Environment OverviewTab find_stack.

Recursive calls to find_stack throw TypError because the
parameter `name` is not passed.

In addition, even if `name` is passed, subsequent calls to
find_stack might result in recursion errors, since
subsequent recursive calls to heat_api.stacks_list do not
change any of the arguments passed to that function.
For recursive calls, `marker` should be passed to
heat_api.stacks_list and it should point to the last stack
id returned, so that future calls exclude already-seen
stack results.

From the heatclient.v1.stacks documentation:
:param marker: begin returning stacks that appear later in the stack
               list than that represented by this stack id

Lastly, this bug fix addresses a dictionary key bug with
get_instance_and_stack in the same module. The key
'instances' is mis-typed as 'instance' which is a bug.

Change-Id: Ifd5d4912eb93c7375ae65f1c1bd12eee78959a67
Closes-Bug: #1641422
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes TypeError/other bugs in Environment OverviewTab find_stack.

Recursive calls to find_stack throw TypError because the
parameter `name` is not passed.

In addition, even if `name` is passed, subsequent calls to
find_stack might result in recursion errors, since
subsequent recursive calls to heat_api.stacks_list do not
change any of the arguments passed to that function.
For recursive calls, `marker` should be passed to
heat_api.stacks_list and it should point to the last stack
id returned, so that future calls exclude already-seen
stack results.

From the heatclient.v1.stacks documentation:
:param marker: begin returning stacks that appear later in the stack
               list than that represented by this stack id

Lastly, this bug fix addresses a dictionary key bug with
get_instance_and_stack in the same module. The key
'instances' is mis-typed as 'instance' which is a bug.

Change-Id: Ifd5d4912eb93c7375ae65f1c1bd12eee78959a67
Closes-Bug: #1641422

As per OpenStack Docstrings guide lines [1]:
[H401] Docstrings should not start with a space.
[H403] Multi line docstrings should end on a new line.
[H404] Multi line docstrings should start without a leading new line.
[H405] Multi line docstrings should start with a one line summary
followed by an empty line.

'}]
commit_message:
Docstrings should not start with a space

As per OpenStack Docstrings guide lines [1]:
[H401] Docstrings should not start with a space.
[H403] Multi line docstrings should end on a new line.
[H404] Multi line docstrings should start without a leading new line.
[H405] Multi line docstrings should start with a one line summary
followed by an empty line.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#docstrings

Change-Id: Ic943e837b8b4f55c2957643ad29dfa004b3c2eb3

subject: Prevent pxe_ilo driver from guessing the boot mode to use
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 10:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Prevent pxe_ilo driver from guessing the boot mode to use

The iLO drivers try to set boot mode to UEFI when they detect UEFI-capable hardware.
This can be surprising for operators, as it's not consistent with other drivers.
Also, UEFI support in TripleO is somewhat less mature.

Change the default boot mode to "bios" via puppet. Operators can still change
the boot mode per node by setting an appropriate capability.

Change-Id: Ide26d05289ba962759163a60dab06e5152812dba
Closes-Bug: #1604002
(cherry picked from commit f3fd1e384e90db5f23a9bec7836633f122f03cc2)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent pxe_ilo driver from guessing the boot mode to use

The iLO drivers try to set boot mode to UEFI when they detect UEFI-capable hardware.
This can be surprising for operators, as it's not consistent with other drivers.
Also, UEFI support in TripleO is somewhat less mature.

Change the default boot mode to "bios" via puppet. Operators can still change
the boot mode per node by setting an appropriate capability.

Change-Id: Ide26d05289ba962759163a60dab06e5152812dba
Closes-Bug: #1604002
(cherry picked from commit f3fd1e384e90db5f23a9bec7836633f122f03cc2)

commit_message:
Remove explicit hiera calls for heat in keystone profile

These are now passed via the heat profiles in t-h-t (via
heat-base.yaml and heat-engine.yaml) and use the actual names of
keystone parameters instead.

Change-Id: Id0f5dd03b6757df989339c93b58a5b7eac3402a2
Depends-On: I0e5124d57fdc519262fdec2dbeaaac85afaeebdf

commit_message:
Use keystone profile parameter to pass heat password

Instead of relying on an explicit hiera call to get the stack domain
password, this uses the keystone parameter to introduce that value
instead.

Change-Id: I0e5124d57fdc519262fdec2dbeaaac85afaeebdf

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 09:54:26.000000000', 'files': ['muranopkgcheck/tests/test_pkg_loader.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: Ie8136f1be4a57272e64b0b360ee608aa270901f7
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: Ie8136f1be4a57272e64b0b360ee608aa270901f7

subject: Add Apache 2.0 license to source file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 08:44:26.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/windows/ExecutionPlan/ExecutionPlanGenerator.py', 'murano-ci/infra/RabbitMQ.py'], 'message': "Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

Change-Id: Ide3b2d067eaa39073c3a7b17537645d4b6f243d6
"}]
commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: Ide3b2d067eaa39073c3a7b17537645d4b6f243d6

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-16 12:34:28.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/controllers/v2/action_execution.py', 'mistral/workflow/with_items.py', 'mistral/engine/policies.py', 'mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_action_executions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_task_defaults.py', 'mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow_rerun_cancelled.py', 'mistral/workflow/states.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_reverse_workflow_rerun_cancelled.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_task_cancel.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_workflow_cancel.py'], 'message': "Add cancelled state to action executions

Allow action executions to be cancelled, specifically for async actions, and
handle the cancellation for task and with-items task appropriately. For
with-items tasks, if one of the action executions is cancelled, then the
task is cancelled. Previously, if there is a mix of error and cancels, the
task is marked with error. But this leads to on-complete being processed
which shouldn't since the with-items task is incomplete due to partially
cancelled.

Change-Id: Iafc2263735f75fe06ae5f03a885cda8f965a7cc4
Implements: blueprint mistral-cancel-state
"}]
commit_message:
Add cancelled state to action executions

Allow action executions to be cancelled, specifically for async actions, and
handle the cancellation for task and with-items task appropriately. For
with-items tasks, if one of the action executions is cancelled, then the
task is cancelled. Previously, if there is a mix of error and cancels, the
task is marked with error. But this leads to on-complete being processed
which shouldn't since the with-items task is incomplete due to partially
cancelled.

Change-Id: Iafc2263735f75fe06ae5f03a885cda8f965a7cc4
Implements: blueprint mistral-cancel-state

commit_message:
Set the (new) SELinux label for OSD data directories on upgrade

Also adds a fcontext rule for the real data path if the OSD data
directory is a symlink.

This is meant to implement on upgrade what the puppet-ceph
module would do on a fresh deployment [1].

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/osd.pp#L140

Closes-Bug: #1640241
Change-Id: I27b45b2a5c200ec976ca31fa62765393e4607a57

subject: plugin interface for manila to backends
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-15 21:21:28.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'requires.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'provides.py', 'interface.yaml', 'LICENSE', 'tox.ini', 'README.md'], 'message': 'plugin interface for manila to backends

This commit contains the interface code to connect between the
manila charm and a backend plugin that will provide configuration
for the manila.

Plugin charms are subordinate because they need to be on the same
unit/machine as the manila file share service.

This interface also implements a 1-many interface and so contains code
to manage that.  That code will be abstracted back to charms.openstack
at some point.

Change-Id: Ied0ad014ab7b1d4778113b0d3f2bbae08075372e
'}]
commit_message:
plugin interface for manila to backends

This commit contains the interface code to connect between the
manila charm and a backend plugin that will provide configuration
for the manila.

Plugin charms are subordinate because they need to be on the same
unit/machine as the manila file share service.

This interface also implements a 1-many interface and so contains code
to manage that.  That code will be abstracted back to charms.openstack
at some point.

Change-Id: Ied0ad014ab7b1d4778113b0d3f2bbae08075372e

commit_message:
Add notes to the making-a-change page about charmhelpers

For old style charms it is not clear that charmhelpers is synced
into the charm.  Therefore, this change adds some notes and
guidance on how to approach changing charm-helpers if it is
necessary.

Change-Id: I839eb556e6b8a1f142ac28b75c5a6fd5aa070d0b

This CLI arg was deprecated in Newton in favour of using the param in a
environment file. The CLI argument is still present but is no longer the
recommended approach and will be removed in the future. It was deprecated as
it maps directly to a Heat parameter and it makes more sense to store it

commit_message:
Remove usage of --compute-scale from the scale roles docs

This CLI arg was deprecated in Newton in favour of using the param in a
environment file. The CLI argument is still present but is no longer the
recommended approach and will be removed in the future. It was deprecated as
it maps directly to a Heat parameter and it makes more sense to store it
in an environment file with the other Heat parameters in the deployment.

Change-Id: Ifb212c7ecaa145726b3c324f7064e62e10d006e8

commit_message:
Add kolla-ansible as a deliverable to governance repository

Many folks in the broader open source ecosystem have a strong
desire for Kolla to make OpenStack containers available as a
standalone repository.

Agred upon by vote in this upstream mailing list thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/103721.html

subject: Remove usage of --control-scale from the HA docs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-09 10:57:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/advanced_deployment/high_availability.rst'], 'message': 'Remove usage of --control-scale from the HA docs

This CLI arg was deprecated in Newton in favour of using the param in a
environment file. The CLI argument is still present but is no longer the
recommended approach and will be removed in the future. It was deprecated as
it maps directly to a Heat parameter and this it makes more sense to store it
in an environment file with the other Heat parmeters in the deployment.

Change-Id: Ifc99b2390b29fa3729cfa04d4178ff236a434246
'}]
commit_message:
Remove usage of --control-scale from the HA docs

This CLI arg was deprecated in Newton in favour of using the param in a
environment file. The CLI argument is still present but is no longer the
recommended approach and will be removed in the future. It was deprecated as
it maps directly to a Heat parameter and this it makes more sense to store it
in an environment file with the other Heat parmeters in the deployment.

Change-Id: Ifc99b2390b29fa3729cfa04d4178ff236a434246

commit_message:
Remove usage of --compute-scale from the baremetal overcloud docs

This CLI arg was deprecated in Newton in favour of using the param in a
environment file. The CLI argument is still present but is no longer the
recommended approach and will be removed in the future. It was deprecated as
it maps directly to a Heat parameter and this it makes more sense to store it
in an environment file with the other Heat parmeters in the deployment.

Change-Id: I4b751cc99a8978a1bcfa83f7bb3f3baeb764c682

subject: Enable creating images with Glance v2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-16 07:16:09.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_overcloud_image.py'], 'message': "Enable creating images with Glance v2

The main difference between the interface for Glance v1 and Glance v2
is the definition of the image's visibility, which in v1 is defined
by a boolean called 'is_public', while in v2 it's a string valled
'visibility'. This enables the usage of both, depending on the
version used by the deployer.

Change-Id: Ife16a6997c60ddc941527ab51cb3fe2ab0b24c5a
"}]
commit_message:
Enable creating images with Glance v2

The main difference between the interface for Glance v1 and Glance v2
is the definition of the image's visibility, which in v1 is defined
by a boolean called 'is_public', while in v2 it's a string valled
'visibility'. This enables the usage of both, depending on the
version used by the deployer.

Change-Id: Ife16a6997c60ddc941527ab51cb3fe2ab0b24c5a

tempest.scenario.test_security_groups_basic_ops.\

Related-Bug: #1641125

subject: Fix multi arch repo-build
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 19:54:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/repo-build.yml'], 'message': "Fix multi arch repo-build

The existing multi arch repo build is broken because the add_host module
bypasses the host play loop of ansible and is only executed on the first
host. To excute on multiple hosts the 'with_' directive must be used.
The result of the existing code is that the repo_nodes group is always
empty because the first host is always skipped by the when clause.

Change-Id: I2c37217a78c006ae28a4f31f3d86244ef4df60be
Closes-Bug: #1641410
(cherry picked from commit 1e0c11f4165d8e74c028e5e439b93ca083e1515d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix multi arch repo-build

The existing multi arch repo build is broken because the add_host module
bypasses the host play loop of ansible and is only executed on the first
host. To excute on multiple hosts the 'with_' directive must be used.
The result of the existing code is that the repo_nodes group is always
empty because the first host is always skipped by the when clause.

Change-Id: I2c37217a78c006ae28a4f31f3d86244ef4df60be
Closes-Bug: #1641410
(cherry picked from commit 1e0c11f4165d8e74c028e5e439b93ca083e1515d)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-08 14:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Change RPC post_live_migration_at_destination from cast to call.

Commit cfa7a261f30b7b3158862aa6ba5916549a904f3d changed call to cast,
but by the time no-one considered that we will need to do some operations
that cannot run in parallel. One of such operations is updating
migration status to track resources in a correct way, see patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/244489/. Because _post_live_migration()
and post_live_migration_at_destination() will race on updating migration
status resource tracker will not be able to track resources correctly
and might use instance.numa_topology corresponding to the source node
while running resource audit at destination node.

Change-Id: I687f9ee2f2b7fdfa92a2e9e6fefda2ed4fe6b561
'}]
commit_message:
Change RPC post_live_migration_at_destination from cast to call.

Commit cfa7a261f30b7b3158862aa6ba5916549a904f3d changed call to cast,
but by the time no-one considered that we will need to do some operations
that cannot run in parallel. One of such operations is updating
migration status to track resources in a correct way, see patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/244489/. Because _post_live_migration()
and post_live_migration_at_destination() will race on updating migration
status resource tracker will not be able to track resources correctly
and might use instance.numa_topology corresponding to the source node
while running resource audit at destination node.

Change-Id: I687f9ee2f2b7fdfa92a2e9e6fefda2ed4fe6b561

commit_message:
correctly spell yaql_limit_iterators

A recent change (55ccd0e) introduced support for the yaql_memory_quota
and yaql_limit_iterators options in puppet-heat, but omitted the yaql_
prefix on limit_iterators.

Change-Id: Ice258c8afcb501b1742487c3de572121dbec8a44

subject: Reuse existing tempest workspace
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 12:23:00.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/tempest_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'Reuse existing tempest workspace

If the tempest role is re-run against a host it will fail attempting to
re-initialize over an existing workspace. Update the changed_when and
failed_when conditions to allow reusing an existing workspace. Also
provide the path to the workspace rather than working from within the
tempest directory to avoid stderr and stdout being written to logs.

Change-Id: Ie88cb72b0d7cd3ef07ab269f2580485a7eeae3c6
(cherry picked from commit 3f54816df6742a0443292f54d7df327a9348106d)
'}]
commit_message:
Reuse existing tempest workspace

If the tempest role is re-run against a host it will fail attempting to
re-initialize over an existing workspace. Update the changed_when and
failed_when conditions to allow reusing an existing workspace. Also
provide the path to the workspace rather than working from within the
tempest directory to avoid stderr and stdout being written to logs.

Change-Id: Ie88cb72b0d7cd3ef07ab269f2580485a7eeae3c6
(cherry picked from commit 3f54816df6742a0443292f54d7df327a9348106d)

commit_message:
Temporarily disable the flakey Cinder test

In order to unblock our CI we need to temporarily disable the
VolumesV2GetTest.test_volume_create_get_update_delete test until
packaging can be updated with a newer version of PyMySQL.

Change-Id: I4c5f2c9c4017ec2f2d485f08b5fe7c79f7817b3b
Related-Bug: #1641312

subject: Reinitialize venv upon install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 04:16:50.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install.yml'], 'message': 'Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I82b835360afa2266429ae0468e7960fbee7c8c8a
Partial-Bug: #1637509
'}]
commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I82b835360afa2266429ae0468e7960fbee7c8c8a
Partial-Bug: #1637509

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I1d6c3765e781b706244fdf0e91c1d6a51679d062
Partial-Bug: #1637509

subject: Allow a single-node MariaDB cluster to restart properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 14:32:53.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Allow a single-node MariaDB cluster to restart properly

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/382683 a single
MariaDB node has no peers configured, so there's no need to bootstrap
the cluster on restart.

This patch removes the condition in the handler which previously was
needed to handle the re-bootstrap during a single node cluster service
restart.

Closes-Bug: #1595143
Closes-Bug: #1639900
Related-Bug: #1624327
Change-Id: I599bbf0efa4e3d5abdf6d95c95d7983c464b3ae5
(cherry picked from commit ff4e9c6ece0849d08f36dda93315181fe5a75339)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow a single-node MariaDB cluster to restart properly

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/382683 a single
MariaDB node has no peers configured, so there's no need to bootstrap
the cluster on restart.

This patch removes the condition in the handler which previously was
needed to handle the re-bootstrap during a single node cluster service
restart.

Closes-Bug: #1595143
Closes-Bug: #1639900
Related-Bug: #1624327
Change-Id: I599bbf0efa4e3d5abdf6d95c95d7983c464b3ae5
(cherry picked from commit ff4e9c6ece0849d08f36dda93315181fe5a75339)

commit_message:
Clarify a list of files to be included in diagnostic snapshot

A bug in nailgun's logs collection process was found. It causes a
loot of copies of master's /var/log/dump dir to be included in
created snapshot. This bug can cause snapshot collection error.

A list of file to put into diagnostic snapshot was clarified.

Change-Id: I31601eb09a27cb6c97b687075bb806e06bbd4827
Closes-bug: #1641632

commit_message:
Python 3 Compatible JSON

In order to be really python3 compatible, the json lib was replaced
with oslo.serialization(1.10 or newer) module jsontuils since it's
the recommended migration to python3 guide.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Serialization:_base64.2C_JSON.2C_etc.

Change-Id: I2d8b62e642aba4ccd1b70be7e9b3784a95a6743d
Closes-Bug: #1629068

commit_message:
Define region name variables in openrc and clouds.

Add OS_REGION_NAME to the openrc file.  Replaces openrc_clouds_yml_region_name
with a common openrc_service_region variable.

Change-Id: I68cbd6b2aaa64ef655cfc617a96d428fb2c35d2b
(cherry picked from commit c6dec23ba1139c090fe9365f0f04dc68fe40f3a6)
